com.bmwcarit.barefoot.road

Class BaseRoad

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bmwcarit.barefoot.road.BaseRoad
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class BaseRoad
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Road data structure for a road segment. Provides topological information, i.e. source() and target()), road type information, i.e. oneway(), type(), priority() and maxspeed(Heading)), and geometrical information (e.g. length() and geometry()).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseRoad

        public BaseRoad(long id,
                long source,
                long target,
                long refid,
                boolean oneway,
                short type,
                float priority,
                float maxspeedForward,
                float maxspeedBackward,
                float length,
                com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline geometry)
        Constructs BaseRoad object.
        Parameters:
        id - Unique road identifier.
        source - Source vertex identifier (in road topology representation).
        target - Target vertex identifier (in road topology representation).
        refid - Identifier of road referring to some source data.
        oneway - Indicator if this road is a one-way road.
        type - Identifier of this road's type.
        priority - Road priority factor, which is greater or equal than one.
        maxspeedForward - Maximum speed limit for passing this road from source to target.
        maxspeedBackward - Maximum speed limit for passing this road from target to source.
        length - Length of road geometry in meters.
        geometry - Road's geometry from source to target as Polyline object.

      • BaseRoad

        public BaseRoad(long id,
                long source,
                long target,
                long osmId,
                boolean oneway,
                short type,
                float priority,
                float maxspeedForward,
                float maxspeedBackward,
                float length,
                byte[] wkb)
        Constructs BaseRoad object.
        Parameters:
        id - Unique road identifier.
        source - Source vertex identifier (in road topology representation).
        target - Target vertex identifier (in road topology representation).
        osmId - Identifier of corresponding OpenStreetMap road.
        oneway - Indicator if this road is a one-way road.
        type - Identifier of this road's type.
        priority - Road priority factor, which is greater or equal than one.
        maxspeedForward - Maximum speed limit for passing this road from source to target.
        maxspeedBackward - Maximum speed limit for passing this road from target to source.
        length - Length of road geometry in meters.
        wkb - Road's geometry in WKB format from source to target.

    • Method Detail

      • id

        public long id()
        Gets unique road identifier.
        Returns:
        Unique road identifier.

      • source

        public long source()
        Gets source vertex identifier.
        Returns:
        Source vertex identifier.

      • target

        public long target()
        Gets target vertex identifier.
        Returns:
        Target vertex identifier.

      • refid

        public long refid()
        Gets identifier of road reference from the source.

        Note: A routable road map requires splitting of roads into segments to build a road topology (graph). Since OpenStreetMap roads span often roads over multiple intersections, they must be split into multiple road segments. Hence, it is a one-to-many relationship.

        Returns:
        Identifier of referred OpenStreetMap road.

      • oneway

        public boolean oneway()
        Gets a boolean if this is a one-way.
        Returns:
        True if this road is a one-way road, false otherwise.

      • type

        public short type()
        Gets road's type identifier.
        Returns:
        Road type identifier.

      • priority

        public float priority()
        Gets road's priority factor, i.e. an additional cost factor for routing, and must be greater or equal to one. Higher priority factor means higher costs.
        Returns:
        Road's priority factor.

      • maxspeed

        public float maxspeed(Heading heading)
        Gets road's maximum speed for respective heading in kilometers per hour.
        Parameters:
        heading - Heading for which maximum speed must be returned.
        Returns:
        Maximum speed in kilometers per hour.

      • length

        public float length()
        Gets road length in meters.
        Returns:
        Road length in meters.

      • geometry

        public com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline geometry()
        Gets road's geometry as a Polyline from the road's source to its target.
        Returns:
        Road's geometry as Polyline from source to target.

      • wkb

        public byte[] wkb()
        Gets road's geometry as a ByteBuffer in WKB format from the road's source to its target.
        Returns:
        Road's geometry as a ByteBuffer in WKB format from the road's source to its target.
